intro: Randia forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' randia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. Randia forbesii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
